definitions.example: The brook had shrunk to a mere trickle.

definitions.definition: A very thin flow; the act of trickling.
definitions.example: The tap of the washbasin in my bedroom is leaking and the trickle drives me mad at night.

definitions.definition: To pour a liquid in a very thin stream, or so that drops fall continuously.
definitions.example: The doctor trickled some iodine on the wound.

definitions.definition: To flow in a very thin stream or drop continuously.
definitions.example: Here the water just trickles along, but later it becomes a torrent.
